name: Shepherd's purse
overview: This annual herb has bright yellow colored flowers, each petal is a centimeter long. At the end of each stalk has a single poppy flower. The four white flower petals are sometimes pale pink, and narrow towards the base. Its fruit is shaped like a flat heart. Additionally, its seeds are flat and long and have a red-yellow-brown color.
habitat: It is endemic to California: mostly seen along foothills however, also grows in the Central valley as well as within the Sierra Nevada foothills
tags: white flower plant Capsella bursa-pastoris Shepherd's purse plants
